sen.j: 壁画（へきが）は、建築物や洞窟の壁・天井などに描かれた絵画。
sen.e: Murals are paintings applied to the surface of walls and ceilings of buildings and caves.
Murals are paintings applied to the surface of walls and ceilings of buildings and caves.
Wall paintings are paintings applied to the surface of walls and ceilings of buildings and caves.
sen.cmt: 前出用語に合わせました。

sen.j: 人類の最も古い絵画は、洞窟の凹凸を利用して描いた壁画（洞窟壁画）であり、人類が建物を作るようになって以後もその壁面に絵画が描かれるなど、絵画は居住空間や神聖な空間の壁と切り離せない存在だった。
sen.e: The oldest existing painting is murals drawn on the walls of caves (cave paintings) taking advantage of its concave-convex surface, and since humans started constructing buildings, paintnings were being applied to their walls and became inseparable parts of the walls of living and divine space.

The oldest existing painting is murals drawn on the walls of caves (cave paintings) taking advantage of its concave-convex surface, and since humans started constructing buildings, paintnings were being applied to their walls and became inseparable parts of the walls of living and divine space.

The oldest existing painting is wall paintings drawn on the walls of caves (cave paintings) taking advantage of its concave-convex surface, and since humans started constructing buildings, paintings were being applied to their walls and became inseparable parts of the walls of living and divine space.
sen.cmt: 前出用語に合わせました。

sen.j: 絵画は次第に洞窟や建物の壁面から離れ、独立した板や布（タブロー）に描かれるようになった。
sen.e: Paintings began to be gradually drawn on wooden panels and cloth (tableau) existing separately and independently from the walls of caves and buildings.
Paintings began to be gradually drawn on wooden panels and cloth (tableau) existing separately and independently from the walls of caves and buildings.
Paintings began to be gradually drawn on wooden panels and cloth (tableau) existing separately and independently from the walls of caves and buildings.

sen.j: しかし、多くの人が同時に見ることができ、しかも空間全体を変容させて見る人を包み込む効果のある壁画・天井画は、今でも数多く制作されている。
sen.e: Actually, a number of ceiling and wall paintings are still produced, providing the effect that wall and ceiling paintings are enjoyable for many viewers at the same time and able to turn the whole space to the one likely to make the viewers feel cuddled by the atomosphere.

Actually, a number of ceiling and wall paintings are still produced, providing the effect that wall and ceiling paintings are enjoyable for many viewers at the same time and able to turn the whole space to the one likely to make the viewers feel surrounded by the atomosphere.

In fact, a number of ceiling and wall paintings are still produced, providing the effect that wall and ceiling paintings are enjoyable for many viewers at the same time and able to turn the whole space to the one likely to make the viewers feel surrounded by the atmosphere.
sen.cmt: スペル修正しました。Actually→In factに変更しました。

tit.e: From ancient times to medieval times
From ancient times to medieval times
From Ancient Times to Medieval Times

sen.j: 世界中の遺跡から壁画は出土している。
sen.e: Murals have been dug out from relics all over the world.
Murals have been dug up all over the world.
Wall paintings have been dug up all over the world.
sen.cmt: 前出用語に合わせました。

sen.j: 石器時代の洞窟の天井や側面に描かれた洞窟壁画は、現存する人類最古の絵画である。
sen.e: Paintings which were drawn on the ceilings and side area of caves in the Stone Age are the oldest existing ones.
Paintings drawn on the ceilings and cave walls during the Stone Age are the oldest existing ones.
Paintings drawn on the ceilings and cave walls during the Stone Age are the oldest existing ones.

sen.j: これら洞窟壁画はさまざまな色の土を顔料に使い、洞窟内の凹凸を利用して描かれ、おそらく祭祀などに使われたものと思われる。
sen.e: These cave murals, which were produced using various kinds of colored pigment soil and taking advantage of the cave's concave-convex surface, seem to have taken a certain role for ceremonial services.
These cave murals, produced using various kinds of colored soil pigments, taking advantage of the cave's concave-convex surfaces, seem to have played a certain role in ceremonies.
These cave wall paintings, produced using various kinds of colored soil pigments, taking advantage of the cave's concave-convex surfaces, seem to have played a certain role in ceremonies.
sen.cmt: 前出用語に合わせました。

sen.j: 歴史時代に入ると、墳墓や建物の壁面が絵で飾られるようになった。
sen.e: In the historical era, paintings began to be drawn on the walls of tombs and buildings for decoration purposes.
In the historical era, paintings began to be done on walls of tombs and buildings for decorative purposes.
In the historical era, paintings began to be done on walls of tombs and buildings for decorative purposes.

sen.j: アジアではインドや中央アジアの石窟などに仏教壁画が描かれ、中国や朝鮮、そして日本の仏教美術に影響を与えた。
sen.e: In Asia, Buddhist murals were created in stone caves in India and the Central Asia, which influenced the Buddhist art in China, Korea and Japan.
In Asia, Buddhist murals were created in stone caves in India and Central Asia, which influenced Buddhist art in China, Korea, and Japan.
In Asia, Buddhist wall paintings were created in stone caves in India and Central Asia, which influenced Buddhist art in China, Korea, and Japan.
sen.cmt: 前出用語に合わせました。

sen.j: 初期の日本の古墳や寺院の壁画には高句麗などとの手法や技術の共通点も見られる。
sen.e: Murals in first ancient tombs and temples in Japan seem to have something in common with those in Koguryo in terms of method and technique.
Murals in the first ancient tombs and temples in Japan seem to have something in common with those found in Koguryo in terms of method and technique.
Wall paintings in the first ancient tombs and temples in Japan seem to have something in common with those found in Koguryo in terms of method and technique.
sen.cmt: 前出用語に合わせました。

sen.j: 西洋では古代エジプト・古代ギリシア・古代ローマの住居などの跡に壁画が見られる。
sen.e: In the West, murals were discovered in the sites where houses were built in the ancient Egypt, Greek and Rome.
In the West, murals were discovered in the sites where houses were built in the ancient Egypt, Greek and Rome.
In the West, wall paintings were discovered in the sites where houses were built in the ancient Egypt, Greek and Rome.
sen.cmt: 前出用語に合わせました。

sen.j: 特にサントリーニ島やポンペイ、ヘルクラネウムなど火山災害に襲われて瞬時に埋まった地域では建物の中から保存状態の良い壁画が発見されている。
sen.e: Particularly in the regions which were hit by the volcanic disasters and covered with ash soon such as Santorini Island, Pompei and Herculaneum, well-preserved murals were discovered in the debris of the buried buildings.

Particularly in regions hit by the volcanic disasters and covered quickly with ash such as Santorini Island, Pompei and Herculaneum, well-preserved murals were discovered in the debris of the buried buildings.

Particularly in regions hit by the volcanic disasters and covered quickly with ash such as Santorini Island, Pompei and Herculaneum, well-preserved wall paintings were discovered in the debris of the buried buildings.
sen.cmt: 前出用語に合わせました。

sen.j: こうした西洋の壁画の技法は「フレスコ」と呼ばれるもので、後にキリスト教会などの壁画や天井画にも使われ、ペンキやスプレーが普及した21世紀でも壁画制作に使用されている。
sen.e: The technique used to draw those wall paintings in the West was called 'fresco' and was applied in creating wall and ceiling paintings in churches, etc. in later years, and still in the 21st century, are used for the production of murals though regular-type and spray paints are available.

The technique used to draw such wall paintings in the West was called 'fresco' and was applied in creating wall and ceiling paintings in churches, etc. in later years, and still in the 21st century, are used for the production of murals though regular-type and spray paints are now available.

The technique used to draw such wall paintings in the West was called 'fresco' and was applied in creating wall and ceiling paintings in churches, and so on, in later years, and still in the 21st century, are used for the production of wall paintings although regular-type and spray paints are now available.
sen.cmt: 前出用語に合わせました。though →although に変更しました。

sen.j: ミケランジェロ・ブオナローティの作であるバチカンのシスティーナ礼拝堂の『最後の審判 (ミケランジェロ)』などは有名である。
sen.e: Michelangelo Buonarroti's product "Last Judgement (Michelangelo)" which is displayed in Cappella Sistina in Vatican is famous for applying that technique.'
Michelangelo Buonarroti's product "Last Judgement (Michelangelo)" which is displayed in Cappella Sistina in the Vatican is famous for applying that technique.'
Michelangelo Buonarroti's product "Last Judgment" which is displayed in Sistina Chapel in Vatican is famous for applying that technique.

sen.j: また、レオナルド・ダ・ヴィンチによるミラノのサンタ・マリア・デッレ・グラツィエ修道院の食堂の壁画『最後の晩餐 (レオナルド)』もこの時代の有名な壁画だが、これはテンペラ画であり、食堂という環境もあり劣化が早かった。
sen.e: Also, Leonardo da Vinci's product "The Last Supper (Leonardo)" which is displayed on the wall of the dining room in Church and Dominican Convent of Santa Maria delle Grazie is a well-known wall painting in tempera style in this era, and deterioration in the painting accelerated due to the environmental factor that the drawing was being placed in the dining room.

Also, Leonardo da Vinci's product "The Last Supper (Leonardo)" which is displayed on the wall of the dining room in Church and Dominican Convent of Santa Maria delle Grazie is a well-known wall painting in tempera style in this era, and deterioration in the painting accelerated due to environmental factors that it was placed in a dining room.

Also, Leonardo da Vinci's product "The Last Supper" which is displayed on the wall of the dining room in Church and Dominican Convent of Santa Maria delle Grazie is a well-known wall painting in tempera style in this era, and deterioration in the painting accelerated due to environmental factors that it was placed in a dining room.

sen.j: メソアメリカでは、チアパス州のボナンパク遺跡（古典期後期）と中央高原のカカシュトラ遺跡（後古典期前期）の壁画がよく知られている。
sen.e: In Mesoamerica, the wall paintings in Bonampak ruins in the State of Chiapas (Late Classic) and Cacaxtla Archaeological Ruins (Early Postclassic) in the Central Palteau are well-known.
In Mesoamerica, the wall paintings in Bonampak ruins in the State of Chiapas (Late Classic) and Cacaxtla Archaeological Ruins (Early Postclassic) in the Central Palteau are well-known.
In Mesoamerica, the wall paintings in Bonampak ruins in the State of Chiapas (Late Classic period) and Cacaxtla Archaeological Ruins (Early Post Classic period) in the Central Plateau are well-known.

sen.j: アンデス文明では、プレ・インカの時代からリマ文化やモチェ文化などの神殿のやわらかな日干し煉瓦（アドベ）の壁面に施された浮き彫りに彩色されている事例のほかにエル＝ブルーホ、パニャマルカがなどで直接彩色した壁画が見られる。
sen.e: Regarding the Cultures of the Andes, even in the pre-Inka period, there are colored reliefs which were produced on the sun-dry brick (adobe) walls of shrines in the Lima Culture and Moche Culture and also, murals which were colored directly with El Brujo and Pañamarca in the shrines.

Regarding the Cultures of the Andes, even in the pre-Inka period, there are colored reliefs produced on sun-dried brick (adobe) walls of shrines in the Lima Culture and Moche Culture and also, murals colored directly with El Brujo and Pañamarca in the shrines.

Regarding the Cultures of the Andes, even in the pre-Inca period, there are colored reliefs produced on sun-dried brick (adobe) walls of shrines in the Lima Culture and Moche Culture and also, wall paintings colored directly with El Brujo and Panamarca in the shrines.
sen.cmt: 英語表記にし、前出用語に合わせました。

sen.j: またモチェより後に北海岸で北方のヘケテペケ川中流域のバタン＝グランデを中心に10世紀ごろ繁栄したシカン文化のベンタナス神殿にも見られる。
sen.e: Around the 10th century after the Moche Culture disappeared, the Sican Culture developed mainly in Batan Grande along River Hequetepeque which was located north of the North Coast, and there are murals in Ventanas Shrine which was built at that time.

Around the 10th century after the Moche Culture disappeared, the Sican Culture developed mainly in Batan Grande along the River Hequetepeque located north of the North Coast, and there are murals in the Ventanas Shrine built at that time.

Around the 10th century after the Moche Culture disappeared, the Sican Culture developed mainly in Batan Grande along the Jequetepeque River located north of the North Coast, and there are wall paintings in the Ventanas Shrine built at that time.
sen.cmt: the Jequetepeque Riverとし、前出用語に合わせました。

sen.j: 古代の壁画は、遺跡や墳墓の発掘調査の進展と共に多く見つかるようになっているが、長年外気や湿気に触れなかった繊細な壁画はカビや光で痛む可能性があるため、どのように保護し、また観覧に供するかは今後の課題である。
sen.e: More ancient murals have been discovered as the methods or techniques available to unearth ruins and tombs have been advanced, but it is a future issue how to protect delicate murals which were not exposed to outside air or humidity for a long time from deterioration caused by molds and light and how to be presented for public view.

More ancient murals have been discovered as methods or techniques available to unearth ruins and tombs have become advanced, but it is a future issue as to how to protect the delicate murals not exposed to outside air or humidity for a long time, from deterioration caused by molds and light and how to present them for public view.

More ancient wall paintings have been discovered as methods or techniques available to unearth ruins and tombs have become advanced, but it is a future issue as to how to protect the delicate wall paintings not exposed to outside air or humidity for a long time, from deterioration caused by molds and light and how to present them for public view.
sen.cmt: 前出用語に合わせました。

sen.j: ラスコー洞窟は観覧者の吐く息の二酸化炭素や持ち込んだカビ類で洞窟壁画が傷み、閉鎖されているが、これは保存が間一髪で間に合った幸運な例である。
sen.e: Murals in Lascaux Cave were damaged by carbon dioxide exhaled by visitors and molds carried with visitors and the cave has been shut down, and it is a lucky case in which the restoration was barely in time.

Murals in Lascaux Cave were damaged by carbon dioxide exhaled by visitors and mold carried in with visitors and the cave has been shut down, and it is a lucky case in whereby restoration was begun just in time.

Wall paintings in Lascaux Cave were damaged by carbon dioxide exhaled by visitors and mold carried in with visitors and the cave has been shut down, and it is a lucky case in whereby restoration begun before it almost ruined.
sen.cmt: 表現を変え、前出用語に合わせました。

tit.cmt: 前出用語に合わせました。

sen.j: 近代の大衆社会になって、壁画は学のない人々にも主義主張を視覚的に伝える手法として重視された。
sen.e: In modern mass society, murals were considered an important means with which people with less educational background were able to assert their own views or policies in a visual way.
In modern mass society, murals were considered an important means by which people with less of an educational background were able to assert their own views or policies in a visual way.
In modern mass society, wall paintings were considered an important means by which people with less of an educational background were able to assert their own views or policies in a visual way.
sen.cmt: 前出用語に合わせました。

sen.j: 労働運動、民族主義、紛争解決の祈りなどの主張のため、工業地帯や紛争地などにも壁画が描かれている。
sen.e: People painted murals in industrial or war areas in order to deliver their opinion or message based on labor movements and nationalism or in hopes of the resolution of wars or conflicts.
People painted murals in industrial or war areas in order to deliver state opinion or message based on labor movements and nationalism or in hopes for a resolution of wars or conflicts.
People painted wall paintings in industrial or war areas in order to deliver state opinion or message based on labor movements and nationalism or in hopes for a resolution of wars or conflicts.
sen.cmt: 前出用語に合わせました。

sen.j: 1910年以後、メキシコでは民衆にメキシコ人のアイデンティティーとメキシコ革命の主張を伝えるために壁画が多く描かれる様になった。
sen.e: In 1910 in Mexico, Mexican people began to create many murals aiming to establish their identities as Mexican and deliver the purpose and significance of the Mexican Revolution.
In 1910 in Mexico, Mexican people began to create many murals aiming to establish their identities as Mexicans and deliver the purpose and significance of the Mexican Revolution.
After 1910, in Mexico, people began to create many wall paintings aiming to establish their identities as Mexicans and deliver the purpose and significance of the Mexican Revolution.
sen.cmt: 前出用語に合わせ、表現を変えました。

sen.j: この歴史上有名なメキシコ壁画運動にはディエゴ・リベラ、ダビッド・アルファロ・シケイロス、ホセ・クレメンテ・オロスコらの作家がいる。
sen.e: Artists who were supporting a famous historic movement, the Mexican Mural Movement were Diego Rivera, David Alfaro Siqueiros and José Clemente Orozco.
Artists who were supporting a famous historic movement, the Mexican Mural Movement were Diego Rivera, David Alfaro Siqueiros and José Clemente Orozco.
Artists who were supporting a famous historic movement, the Mexican wall painting Movement, were Diego Rivera, David Alfaro Siqueiros and Jose Clemente Orozco.
sen.cmt: 英語表記にし、前出用語に合わせました。

sen.j: その他アメリカ合衆国でも大恐慌の際に連邦美術計画によって失業画家を雇って公共建築に壁画が描かれ、共産主義国では多くの政治的スローガンと共にプロパガンダ用の壁画が描かれた。
sen.e: In the United States, out-of-work artists who were employed under the Federal Art Project during the Great Depression-era drew murals on public buildings, and in communist countries, many murals were created to deliver political slogans and for propaganda purposes.

In the United States, out-of-work artists who were employed under the Federal Art Project during the Great Depression-era drew murals on public buildings, and in communist countries, many murals were created to deliver political slogans and for propaganda purposes.

In the United States, out-of-work artists who were employed under the Federal Art Project during the Great Depression era drew wall paintings on public buildings, and in communist countries, many wall paintings were created to deliver political slogans and for propaganda purposes.
sen.cmt: 表記を変え、前出用語に合わせました。

sen.j: 北アイルランドは、1970年代以降、建物の多くにイギリスとの連合維持を求めるユニオニストやイギリスからの独立を求めるナショナリスト双方の主張を交えた政治的な壁画が描かれ、そのいくつかは紛争をあおるとして論議を呼んだり塗り替えられている。
sen.e: In Northern Ireland, after the 1970s, political-minded murals were drawn on many buildings based on the ideology of the Unionist who were wishing their area to remain or become part of the United Kingdom and the ideology of the Nationalist who were wishing their area to become independent from the United Kindgom, and part of such murals caused controversies because they might trigger a conflict, and was eventually redrawn.

In Northern Ireland, after the 1970s, politically-minded murals were drawn on many buildings based on the ideology of the Unionist who were wishing their area to remain or become part of the United Kingdom and the ideology of the Nationalist who wanted their area to become independent from the United Kindgom, and some of these murals caused controversy and coul ignite a conflict, and were eventually redrawn.

In Northern Ireland, after the 1970s, politically-minded wall paintings were drawn on many buildings based on the ideology of the Unionist who were wishing their area to remain or become part of the United Kingdom and the ideology of the Nationalist who wanted their area to become independent from the United Kingdom, and some of these wall paintings caused controversy and co lignite a conflict, and were eventually redrawn.
sen.cmt: 前出用語に合わせました。

sen.j: 1980年代以降世界中に広がったグラフィティ（落書き）も、建物の所有者の了解を得ない器物破損である一方、若者のさまざまな主張や趣味を表現しているものともいえ、次第に壁面全体を大きく使うものが現れるようになっている。
sen.e: While graffiti (doodle) which spread on a global scale in the 1980s and afterward is considered a damage to property without the owner's approval, it can be said that the graffiti demonstrates young people's views and hobby, and gradually, a picture which was drawn on an entire surface of a wall began to appear.

While graffiti (doodling) which spread on a global scale in the 1980s and later considered damage to property without the owner's approval, it can be said that the graffiti demonstrates young people's views and interests, and gradually, a pictures drawn on an entire surface of a wall began to appear.

While graffiti (doodling) which spread on a global scale in the 1980s and later considered damage to property without the owner's approval, it can be said that the graffiti demonstrates young people's views and interests, and gradually, a pictures drawn on an entire surface of a wall began to appear.
sen.cmt: 余分な改行をのぞきました。

sen.j: キース・ヘリングは美術界で認められ有名になった人物だが、その他にも多くのグラフィティ・アーティストが世界中におり、美術館などでも取り上げられるようになってきている。
sen.e: Keith Haring is a graffiti artist who was recognized in the art society and became well-known, and there are more graffiti painters in the world whose production has begun to be exhibited at museums.
Keith Haring is a graffiti artist who was recognized in art circles and became well-known, and there are more graffiti painters in the world whose art works have begun to be exhibited at museums.
Keith Haring is a graffiti artist who was recognized in art world and became well-known, and there are more graffiti painters in the world whose art works have begun to be exhibited at museums.

sen.j: また、公共の場所や商店街への落書き防止や、地域共同体の結びつきを深めるために、学生を含めたみんなで壁画を作る運動もある。
sen.e: Meanwhile, local people including students in a certain area work together and attempt to produce wall paintings in order to prevent graffiti in public places and shops and also make the community network stronger.

Meanwhile, local people including students in a certain areas, work together and attempt to produce wall paintings in order to prevent graffiti in public places and shops and also make the community network stronger.

Meanwhile, local people including students in a certain areas, work together and attempt to produce wall paintings in order to prevent graffiti in public places and shops and also make the community network stronger.
